promptResults.promptText: What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran emphasizes charity and helping those in need throughout its text. Here are two relevant verses:

<quran ref="2:177">ูููููุณู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ุฃูู ุชูููููููุง ููุฌูููููููู ููุจููู ูฑููููุดูุฑููู ูููฑููููุบูุฑูุจู ูููููฐููููู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ููููุกูุงูููู ุจููฑูููููู ูููฑูููููููู ูฑููุกูุงุฎูุฑู ูููฑูููููููฐูุฆูููุฉู ูููฑููููุชููฐุจู ูููฑููููุจููููฆูู ููุกูุงุชูู ูฑููููุงูู ุนูููููฐ ุญูุจููููฆ ุฐูููู ูฑููููุฑูุจูููฐ ูููฑููููุชููฐููููฐ ูููฑููููุณููฐููููู ูููฑุจููู ูฑูุณููุจูููู ูููฑูุณููุขุฆูููููู ููููู ูฑูุฑููููุงุจู</quran>

Translation: "Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but [true] righteousness is [in] one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to relatives, orphans, the needy, the traveler, those who ask [for help], and for freeing slaves..."

<quran ref="2:273">ููููููููุฑูุขุกู ูฑูููุฐูููู ุฃูุญูุตูุฑููุง ููู ุณูุจูููู ูฑูููููู ููุง ููุณูุชูุทููุนูููู ุถูุฑูุจูุง ููู ูฑููุฃูุฑูุถู ููุญูุณูุจููููู ูฑููุฌูุงูููู ุฃูุบูููููุขุกู ูููู ูฑูุชููุนูููููู ุชูุนูุฑูููููู ุจูุณูููููฐูููู ููุง ููุณููููููููู ูฑููููุงุณู ุฅูููุญูุงููุง ููููุง ุชูููููููุง ูููู ุฎูููุฑู ููุฅูููู ูฑูููููู ุจูููฆ ุนูููููู</quran>

Translation: "[Charity is] for the poor who have been restricted for the cause of Allah, unable to move about in the land... The ignorant one thinks them self-sufficient because of their restraint, [but] you will know them by their [characteristic] sign. They do not ask people persistently. And whatever you spend of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it."

These verses highlight that giving to the needy is a fundamental aspect of righteousness in Islam.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran commands believers to be generous and specifically mentions the needy (al-masฤkฤซn) among those who are entitled to charity. Here are two relevant verses:

**Surah Al-Baqarah 2:215** - This verse specifies that charity should reach the needy among other categories:
<quran ref="2:215">ููุณูุฃูููููููู ููุงุฐูุง ูููููููููู  ูููู ููุง ุฃููููููุชูู ููููู ุฎูููุฑู ููููููููุงููุฏููููู ููุงููุฃูููุฑูุจูููู ููุงููููุชูุงููููฐ ููุงููููุณูุงููููู ููุงุจููู ุงูุณููุจูููู  ููููุง ุชูููุนููููุง ูููู ุฎูููุฑู ููุฅูููู ุงูููููู ุจููู ุนูููููู</quran>

*Translation: "They ask you, [O Muแธฅammad], what they should spend. Say, 'Whatever you spend of good is [to be] for parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it."*

**Surah Al-Baqarah 2:267** - This verse emphasizes giving from the best of one's wealth:
<quran ref="2:267">ููุง ุฃููููููุง ุงูููุฐูููู ุขูููููุง ุฃูููููููุง ููู ุทููููุจูุงุชู ููุง ููุณูุจูุชููู ูููููููุง ุฃูุฎูุฑูุฌูููุง ููููู ููููู ุงููุฃูุฑูุถู  ููููุง ุชูููููููููุง ุงููุฎูุจููุซู ูููููู ุชููููููููู ููููุณูุชูู ุจูุขุฎูุฐูููู ุฅููููุง ุฃูู ุชูุบูููุถููุง ููููู  ููุงุนููููููุง ุฃูููู ุงูููููู ุบูููููู ุญููููุฏู</quran>

*Translation: "O you who have believed, spend from the good things which you have earned and from that which We have produced for you from the earth. And do not aim toward the defective therefrom, spending [from that] while you would not take it [yourself] except with closed eyes. And know that Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy."*

These verses establish both the recipients of charity (including specifically the needy) and the condition that one must give from pure, lawful earnings rather than what is unwanted or defective.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran strongly encourages giving charity (zakat and sadaqah) to the needy, orphans, and the deprived as a fundamental act of faith and righteousness. Here are two relevant verses:

<quran ref="51:19">ูููููู ุฃููููููฐูููููู ุญููููญ ูููุณููุงูุฆููู ููููููููุญูุฑูููู</quran>  
*(And in their wealth is a due right for the beggar and the deprived.)*

<quran ref="9:60">ุฅููููููุง ุงูุตููุฏููููฐุชู ููููููููุฑูุงูุกู ููุงููููุณูุงูฐููููู ููุงููุนููฐููููููู ุนูููููููุง ููุงููููุคููููููุฉู ูููููุจููููู ููููู ุงูุฑููููุงุจู ููุงููุบููฐุฑูููููู ููููู ุณูุจูููู ุงูููููู ููุงุจููู ุงูุณููุจูููู  ููุฑููุถูุฉูญ ูููู ุงูููููู  ููุงูููููู ุนูููููู ุญููููููญ</quran>  
*(Zakah expenditures are only for the poor and for the needy and for those employed to collect [zakah] and for bringing hearts together [for Islam] and for freeing captives [or slaves] and for those in debt and for the cause of Allah and for the [stranded] traveler โ an obligation [imposed] by Allah. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.)*

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
As-salamu alaykum.

The Quran places immense emphasis on caring for the poor and needy, considering it a fundamental aspect of faith and righteousness. Giving in charity is not merely an act of kindness but a duty and a right owed to those in need. Here are two powerful verses on this topic.

The first is a comprehensive verse from Surah Al-Baqarah that defines true righteousness (al-birr). It lists giving wealthโdespite one's love for itโto various categories of needy people as one of the primary characteristics of a truly pious person.

<quran ref="2:177">ูููููุณู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ุฃูู ุชูููููููุง ููุฌูููููููู ููุจููู ูฑููููุดูุฑููู ูููฑููููุบูุฑูุจู ูููููฐููููู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ูููู ุกูุงูููู ุจููฑูููููู ูููฑูููููููู ูฑููุกูุงุฎูุฑู ูููฑูููููููฐูุฆูููุฉู ูููฑููููุชููฐุจู ูููฑููููุจูููููงูู ููุกูุงุชูู ูฑููููุงูู ุนูููููฐ ุญูุจููููฆ ุฐูููู ูฑููููุฑูุจูููฐ ูููฑููููุชููฐููููฐ ูููฑููููุณููฐููููู ูููฑุจููู ูฑูุณููุจูููู ูููฑูุณููุขุฆูููููู ููููู ูฑูุฑููููุงุจู ููุฃูููุงูู ูฑูุตููููููฐุฉู ููุกูุงุชูู ูฑูุฒููููููฐุฉู ูููฑูููููููููู ุจูุนูููุฏููููู ุฅูุฐูุง ุนููฐููุฏููุง  ูููฑูุตูููฐุจูุฑูููู ููู ูฑููุจูุฃูุณูุขุกู ูููฑูุถููุฑููุขุกู ููุญูููู ูฑููุจูุฃูุณู  ุฃูููููฐูุฆููู ูฑูููุฐูููู ุตูุฏููููุง  ููุฃูููููฐูุฆููู ูููู ูฑููููุชููููููู</quran>

A second, very profound verse from Surah Adh-Dhariyat describes the believers and mentions that in their wealth, there is an established right for the petitioner and the deprived. This reframes charity not as a voluntary handout, but as fulfilling a right that the needy have upon the wealth of the affluent.

<quran ref="51:19">ูููููู ุฃููููููฐูููููู ุญููููญ ููููุณููุขุฆููู ูููฑููููุญูุฑูููู</quran>

These verses, among many others, establish charity as a cornerstone of the Islamic faith, intertwined with belief in God, prayer, and social justice.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
# Giving to the Needy in the Quran

The Quran emphasizes charity and caring for those in need throughout its verses. Here are two significant examples:

## 1. Spending from what you love

<quran ref="3:92">ููู ุชูููุงูููุง ูฑููุจูุฑูู ุญูุชููููฐ ุชูููููููุง ูููููุง ุชูุญูุจููููู  ููููุง ุชูููููููุง ููู ุดูููุกู ููุฅูููู ูฑูููููู ุจูููฆ ุนูููููู</quran>

*"You will never attain righteousness until you spend from that which you love. And whatever you spend, indeed Allah is All-Knowing of it."*

## 2. The reward of giving in Allah's cause

<quran ref="2:261">ูููุซููู ูฑูููุฐูููู ูููููููููู ุฃููููููฐูููููู ููู ุณูุจูููู ูฑูููููู ููููุซููู ุญูุจููุฉู ุฃููขุจูุชูุชู ุณูุจูุนู ุณูููุงุจููู ููู ููููู ุณููขุจูููุฉู ูููุงุฆูุฉู ุญูุจููุฉู  ูููฑูููููู ููุถูููฐุนููู ููููู ููุดูุขุกู  ูููฑูููููู ูููฐุณูุนู ุนูููููู</quran>

*"The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed which grows seven spikes; in each spike is a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies [His reward] for whom He wills. And Allah is All-Encompassing and All-Knowing."*

---

These verses highlight that giving is not merely a duty but a path to spiritual growth, with Allah multiplying the reward manifold for those who give sincerely.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
promptResults.rawResponse:
# Ayat al-Kursi (ุขูุฉ ุงููุฑุณู)

<quran ref="2:255">ูฑูููููู ููุข ุฅููููฐูู ุฅููููุง ูููู ูฑููุญูููู ูฑูููููููููู  ููุง ุชูุฃูุฎูุฐูููฅ ุณูููุฉู ููููุง ูููููู  ูููููฅ ููุง ููู ูฑูุณูููููฐูููฐุชู ููููุง ููู ูฑููุฃูุฑูุถู  ููู ุฐูุง ูฑูููุฐูู ููุดูููุนู ุนููุฏูููฅู ุฅููููุง ุจูุฅูุฐูููููฆ  ููุนููููู ููุง ุจููููู ุฃูููุฏูููููู ููููุง ุฎููููููููู  ููููุง ููุญููุทูููู ุจูุดูููุกู ููููู ุนูููููููฆู ุฅููููุง ุจูููุง ุดูุขุกู  ููุณูุนู ููุฑูุณูููููู ูฑูุณูููููฐูููฐุชู ูููฑููุฃูุฑูุถู  ููููุง ููููููุฏูููฅ ุญูููุธูููููุง  ูููููู ูฑููุนูููููู ูฑููุนูุธูููู</quran>

---

**Translation (approximate meaning):**

*"Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi (Throne/Footstool) extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great."*

---

This verse is considered the greatest verse in the Quran, as mentioned in authentic hadith. It is recommended to recite after each obligatory prayer and before sleeping.

promptResults.promptText: What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.

words.word: ุงูุจุฃุณุงุก

promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran strongly emphasizes the importance of giving to the needy, enjoining charity as a fundamental act of worship and righteousness.

Here are two relevant verses:

1.  Regarding the characteristics of the righteous, Allah states:
    <quran ref="3:134">ูููฑูููุฐูููู ูููููููููู ููู ูฑูุณููุฑููุขุกู ูููฑูุถููุฑููุขุกู ูููฑูููููฐุธูููููู ูฑููุบูููุธู ูููฑููุนูุงููููู ุนููู ูฑููููุงุณู  ูููฑูููููู ููุญูุจูู ูฑููููุญูุณูููููู</quran>
    (Translation: And those who spend [in the cause of Allah] during ease and hardship and who restrain anger and who pardon the people - and Allah loves the doers of good [to others].)

2.  The Quran explicitly commands giving to relatives, the needy, the traveler, and others, making it a key righteous deed:
    <quran ref="2:177">ูููููุณู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ุฃูู ุชูููููููุง ููุฌูููููููู ููุจููู ูฑููููุดูุฑููู ูููฑููููุบูุฑูุจู ูููููฐููููู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ูููู ุกูุงูููู ุจููฑูููููู ูููฑูููููููู ูฑููุกูุงุฎูุฑู ูููฑูููููููฐูุฆูููุฉู ูููฑููููุชูุจู ูููฑููููุจูููููงูู ููุกูุงุชูู ูฑููููุงูู ุนูููููฐ ุญูุจููููฆ ุฐูููู ูฑููููุฑูุจูููฐ ูููฑููููุชููฐููููฐ ูููฑููููุณููฐููููู ูููฑุจููู ูฑูุณููุจูููู ูููฑูุณููุขุฆูููููู ููููู ูฑูุฑููููุงุจู ููุฃูููุงูู ูฑูุตููููููฐุฉู ููุกูุงุชูู ูฑูุฒููููููฐุฉู ูููฑูููููููููู ุจูุนูููุฏููููู ุฅูุฐูุง ุนููฐููุฏููุง  ูููฑูุตูููฐุจูุฑูููู ููู ูฑููุจูุฃูุณูุขุกู ูููฑูุถููุฑููุขุกู ููุญูููู ูฑููุจูุฃูุณู  ุฃูููููฐูุฆููู ูฑูููุฐูููู ุตูุฏููููุง  ููุฃูููููฐูุฆููู ูููู ูฑููููุชููููููู</quran>
    (Translation: Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west. Rather, the righteous is he who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets, and gives charity of his wealth out of love for Him to relatives, orphans, the needy, the wayfarer, beggars, and to free slaves, and he who establishes prayer and gives zakฤh. And those who fulfill their covenant when they have covenanted, and who are patient in poverty and affliction and at the time of fighting. Such are those who have been true, and such are those who are the righteous.)

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
### Introduction to Charity in the Quran

The Quran emphasizes the importance of giving to the needy as a fundamental pillar of faith, often through concepts like *zakat* (obligatory almsgiving) and *sadaqah* (voluntary charity). It portrays such acts as a means of purifying wealth, seeking Allah's pleasure, and achieving spiritual rewards. In this regard, the Quran instructs believers to spend on the less fortunate, including the poor, orphans, widows, and travelers, while assuring multiplication of rewards in the Hereafter.

Here are two relevant verses:

<quran ref="2:215">ููุณูุฃูููููููู ููุงุฐูุง ูููููููููู  ูููู ููุง ุฃููููููุชูู ููููู ุฎูููุฑู ููููููููุงููุฏููููู ููุงููุฃูููุฑูุจูููู ููุงููููุชูุงููููฐ ููุงููููุณูุงููููู ููุงุจููู ุงูุณููุจูููู  ููููุง ุชูููุนููููุง ูููู ุฎูููุฑู ููุฅูููู ุงูููููู ุจููู ุนูููููู</quran>

This verse from Surah Al-Baqarah (2:215) directly answers those who ask what should be spent as charity: it specifies spending good things on parents, relatives, orphans, the needy, and the wayfarer, with Allah being fully aware of all good deeds.

<quran ref="9:60">ุฅููููููุง ุงูุตููุฏูููุงุชู ููููููููุฑูุงุกู ููุงููููุณูุงููููู ููุงููุนูุงููููููู ุนูููููููุง ููุงููููุคููููููุฉู ูููููุจููููู ููููู ุงูุฑููููุงุจู ููุงููุบูุงุฑูููููู ููููู ุณูุจูููู ุงูููููู ููุงุจููู ุงูุณููุจูููู  ููุฑููุถูุฉู ูููู ุงูููููู  ููุงูููููู ุนูููููู ุญูููููู</quran>

This verse from Surah At-Taubah (9:60) outlines that alms (zakat) are obligated by Allah for distribution to the poor, orphans, widows, the oppressed, those whose hearts are to be won (for Islam), those indebted, the path of Allah (for jihad or righteous causes), and the travelers. Allah is All-Knowing and Wise, ensuring justice in their allocation.

These verses highlight the Quranic mandate for compassionate giving, encouraging believers to prioritize the welfare of the needy as a path to righteousness. For deeper study, I recommend reflecting on tafsir (exegesis) works like those by Ibn Kathir or Al-Tabari for further context. If you have more specific questions, feel free to ask!

<quran ref="9:60">ููููุง ุชูููุชูููููุง ุงูุทููููุฑู ุงููููุงุญูุฏูุฉู ููุฃูููุชููู ุชูุนูููููููู</quran>

promptResults.rawResponse:
<think>

promptResults.promptText: What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran contains numerous verses that emphasize the importance of giving to the needy. Here are two relevant verses:

<quran ref="2:215">ููุณููููููููููู ููุงุฐูุง ูููููููููู ูููู ูฑููููููุฑููุถู ููููููุฑูุจูููฐ ูููฑููููุชูููฐููููฐ ูููฑููููุณูููฐููููู ูููฑุจููู ูฑูุณููุจูููู  ููููุง ูููุชููู ุชููููููููู ุฅููููุงู ููุงูู ูฑูููููู ุจูููฆ ุนููููููุง</quran>

This verse directly addresses what Muslims should spend on, including the needy (ุงููุณรกkูู - masakin). It indicates that spending on the poor is a prescribed obligation.

<quran ref="9:103">ุฎูุฐู ูููู ุฃูููููุงูููููู ุตูุฏูููุฉู ุชูุทููููุฑููููู ููุชูุฒูููููููู ุจูููุง  ููุตูููู ุนููููููููู  ุฅูููู ุตูููุงุชููู ุณููููู ููููููู  ูููฑูููููู ุณููููุนู ุนูููููู</quran>

This verse instructs taking charity (zakat) from the believers' wealth to purify and sanctify them, highlighting the spiritual benefits of giving to the needy.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.

Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran places immense emphasis on charity (*Sadaqah* and *Zakat*), regarding it not just as a kindness, but as a duty and a means of purification. It promises that wealth is never decreased by charity; rather, it is purified and spiritually increased.

Here are two significant verses discussing the virtues and rewards of giving to the needy.

**1. The Multiplied Reward of Charity**
Allah describes the exponential spiritual growth that comes from spending in His way, comparing a single act of charity to a seed that grows into hundreds of grains.

<quran ref="2:261">ูููุซููู ูฑูููุฐูููู ูููููููููู ุฃูููููุงูููููู ููู ุณูุจูููู ูฑูููููู ููููุซููู ุญูุจููุฉู ุฃููขุจูุชูุชู ุณูุจูุนู ุณูููุงุจููู ููู ููููู ุณููุจูููุฉู ูููุงุฆูุฉู ุญูุจููุฉู  ูููฑูููููู ููุถููฐุนููู ููููู ููุดูุขุกู  ูููฑูููููู ูููฐ

promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran places great emphasis on giving to the needy as an essential aspect of righteous behavior and worship. Here are two relevant verses:

<quran ref="2:177">ุงูููุฐูููู ููุคูููููููู ุจูุงูููููู ููุงูููููููู ุงูุขุฎูุฑู ูููููููููููู ุงูุตูููููุฉู ููููุคูุชูููู ุงูุฒููููุงุฉู ูููููููููู ุจูุงูุนูููุฏู ุฅูุฐูุง ุนูุงููุฏููุง ููุงูุตููุงุจูุฑูููู ููู ุงูุจูุฃูุณูุงุกู ููุงูุถููุฑููุงุกู ููุญูููู ุงููุจูุฃูุณู ุฃููููุฆููู ุงูููุฐูููู ุตูุฏููููุง ููุฃููููุฆููู ูููู ุงูููุชููููููู</quran>

This verse from Surah Al-Baqarah establishes that true righteousness includes belief, prayer, **paying Zakat** (obligatory charity), fulfilling promises, and being patient during hardship. Giving Zakat is presented as a fundamental component of faith.

<quran ref="17:26">ููุขุชู ุฐูุง ุงููููุฑูุจูู ุญูููููู ููุงููููุณูููููู ููุงุจููู ุงูุณููุจูููู ููููุง ุชูุจูุฐููุฑู ุชูุจูุฐููุฑูุง</quran>

From Surah Al-Israa', this verse directly commands believers to give to relatives, the needy (Miskin), and travelers, while advising against wastefulness. It highlights that charitable giving should be directed toward those in genuine need.

The Quran emphasizes the importance of giving to the needy and making charity. Here are two key verses on this topic:

<quran ref="90:11-16">ููุฃููููุง ูฑููููุชูููู ููููุง ุชูููููุฑู ููุฃููููุง ูฑูุณููุงุฆููู ููููุง ุชููููุถู ููุฃููููุง ุจูููุนูููุฉู ุฑูุจูููู ููุญูุฏููุซู ูกูก</quran>

This verse teaches us not to rebuke the orphan and not to turn away the beggar, while proclaiming the blessings of our Lord.

<quran ref="2:264">ูููฐูุฃููููููุง ูฑูููุฐูููู ุกูุงูููููุง ููุง ุชูุจูุทููููุง ุตูุฏููููฐุชูููู ุจููฑููููููู ูููฑููุฃูุฐูููฐ ูููฑูููุฐูู ููููููู ููุงููููฅ ุฑูุฆูุขุกู ูฑููููุงุณู ููููุง ููุคููููู ุจููฑูููููู ูููฑูููููููู ูฑููุกูุงุฎูุฑู ููููุซูููููฅ ููููุซููู ุตูููููุงูู ุนููููููู ุชูุฑูุงุจู ุซูููู ุฃูุตูุงุจูููฅ ููุทูุงุฑู ููุชูุฑูููููฅ ุตูููุฏูุง  ูููุง ููููุฏูุฑูููู ุนูููููฐ ุดูููุกู ููููููุง ููุณูุจููุง  ูููฑูููููู ููุง ููููุฏูู ูฑูููููููู ูฑูููููฐููุฑูููู</quran>

This verse warns believers not to render their charities worthless by reproach and injury, and reminds us that true charity should be given sincerely for the sake of Allah, not for showing off to people.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
As a knowledgeable Islamic scholar, I can share that the Quran emphasizes charity (sadaqah) and obligatory almsgiving (zakat) as fundamental acts of righteousness, particularly towards the needy (al-fuqara' and al-masakin). This is seen as a means of purifying one's wealth, fostering social justice, and earning divine reward. The Quran encourages giving generously, in secret or openly, from what one has earned, and highlights that such acts benefit both the giver and the recipient.

Here are two relevant verses that illustrate this theme:

<quran ref="2:261">ูููุซููู ูฑูููุฐูููู ูููููููููู ุฃููููููฐูููููู ููู ุณูุจูููู ูฑูููููู ููููุซููู ุญูุจููุฉู ุฃููขุจูุชูุชู ุณูุจูุนู ุณูููุงุจููู ููู ููููู ุณููขุจูููุฉูข ูููุงุฆูุฉู ุญูุจููุฉูข  ูููฑูููููู ููุถููฐุนููู ููููู ููุดูุงูุกู  ูููฑูููููู ูููฐุณูุนู ุนููููููญ</quran>

(Translation: "The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed [of grain] which grows seven spikes; in each spike is a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies [His reward] for whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.")

<quran ref="9:60">ุฅููููููุง ูฑูุตููุฏููููฐุชู ููููููููุฑูุงูุกู ูููฑููููุณููฐููููู ูููฑููุนููฐููููููู ุนูููููููุง ูููฑููููุคููููููุฉู ูููููุจููููู ููููู ูฑูุฑููููุงุจู ูููฑููุบููฐุฑูููููู ููููู ุณูุจูููู ูฑูููููู ูููฑุจููู ูฑูุณููุจูููู  ููุฑููุถูุฉูญ ููููู ูฑูููููู  ูููฑูููููู ุนูููููู ุญููููููญ</quran>

(Translation: "Zakah expenditures are only for the poor and for the needy and for those employed to collect [zakah] and for bringing hearts together [for Islam] and for freeing captives [or slaves] and for those in debt and for the cause of Allah and for the [stranded] traveler - an obligation [imposed] by Allah. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.")

These verses underscore the importance of directing charity to those in need, with promises of multiplied rewards and clear guidelines on recipients. If you'd like more context, explanations from tafsir (commentary), or additional verses, feel free to ask!

This verse explains **who is most deserving of charity**, including parents, relatives, orphans, the poor, and travelers, and affirms that Allah knows every good deed.

<quran ref="93:10">ููุฃููููุง ูฑูุณููุงูุฆููู ููููุง ุชูููููุฑู</quran>

This concise verse teaches **kindness and respect toward those who ask for help**, emphasizing compassion as a core moral value in Islam.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.

promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran emphasizes generosity and care for the needy in numerous verses. Here are two key examples:

1. <quran ref="2:267">ูููฐูุฃููููููุง ูฑูููุฐูููู ุกูุงููููููุง ุฃูููููููุง ููู ุทููููุจููฐุชู ููุง ููุณูุจูุชููู ูููููููุข ุฃูุฎูุฑูุฌูููุง ููููู ููููู ูฑููุฃูุฑูุถู  ููููุง ุชูููููููููุง ูฑููุฎูุจููุซู ููุชููููููููู ููููุณูุชูู ุจููููุงุฎูุฐูููู ุฅููููุข ุฃูู ุชูุบูููุถููุง ููููู  ูููฑุนูููููููุง ุฃูููู ูฑูููููู ุบูููููู ุญููููุฏู</quran>

   *Translation*: "O you who believe! Spend from the good things which you have earned and from what We produce for you from the earth. And do not intend to spend the worst of what you have..." (2:267)

2. <quran ref="90:11-16">ุฃูุฑูุกูููุชู ูฑูููุฐูู ููููุฐูุจู ุจููฑูุฏููููู ููุฐููฐูููู ูฑูููุฐูู ููุฏููุนู ูฑููููุชูููู ููููุง ููุญูุถูู ุนูููููฐ ุทูุนูุงูู ูฑููููุณูููููู  ูฑูููุฐูููู ูููููููููู ุฃูุฒููููฐุฌูุข ุฅูุฐูุง ููุงููููุง ุฅููููุงูููู ุตููฐููุญูููู  ููุฃูููุฑูููู ุจููฑููููุนูุฑูููู ูููููููููููู ุนููู ูฑูููููููุฑู ูููููููููููู ูฑูุตููููููฐุฉู ููููุคูุชูููู ูฑูุฒููููููฐุฉู</quran>

   *Translation* (approximate final part of verse 16): "...and feeding the poor at times of famine, orphans..." (90:11-16). This passage condemns those who neglect the orphan's welfare and withhold food from the needy.

Both verses highlight the moral obligation to support vulnerable members of society, particularly those who lack basic necessities. The Quran consistently links charity with ethical behavior and divine reward (e.g., 2:273-274, 30:38).

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
In the Quran, Allah emphasizes that giving to the needy is not merely a voluntary act of kindness, but a spiritual obligation and a means of purifying one's wealth.

One of the most comprehensive verses regarding the categories of people who deserve assistance is found in Surah al-Baqarah:

<quran ref="2:177"> ูููููุณู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ุฃูู ุชูููููููุง ููุฌูููููููู ููุจููู ูฑููููุดูุฑููู ูููฑููููุบูุฑูุจู ููููููฐููููู ูฑููุจูุฑูู ูููู ุกูุงูููู ุจููฑูููููู ูููฑูููููููู ูฑูููููุงุฎูุฑู ูููฑููููููููฐูุฆูููุฉู ูููฑููููุชูููฐุจู ูููฑููููุจูููููงูู ููุกูุงุชูู ูฑููููุงูู ุนูููููฐ ุญูุจููููฆ ุฐูููู ูฑููููุฑูุจูููฐ ูููฑููููุชูููฐููููฐ ูููฑููููุณูููฐููููู ูููฑุจููู ูฑูุณููุจูููู ูููฑูุณููุขุฆูููููู ููููู ูฑูุฑููููุงุจู </quran>

In this verse, Allah explains that true righteousness (Al-Birr) includes giving wealthโdespite one's love for itโto kinsfolk, orphans, the needy (al-masakin), the wayfarer, those who ask, and for the freeing of slaves.

Furthermore, the Quran highlights that the poor have a Divinely ordained right within the wealth of the believers:

<quran ref="51:19">ูููููู ุฃููููููฐูููููู ุญููููญ ููููุณููุขุฆููู ูููฑููููุญูุฑูููู</quran>

This verse translates to: "And in their wealth there was a right for the petitioner and the deprived." This reinforces the concept that charity is not an act of condescension, but rather a fulfillment of a right that Allah has established for the less fortunate.

promptResults.promptText: Please quote Ayat al-Kursi (Quran 2:255) in Arabic.
What does the Quran say about giving to the needy? Please share one or two relevant verses.
promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran emphasizes charity (Sadaqah) and helping the needy as a fundamental act of faith. Here are two key verses with their exact Arabic text:

1. **Surah Al-Baqarah (2:261)**:  
<quran ref="2:261">ูููุซููู ูฑูููุฐูููู ูููููููููู ุฃููกูููฐูููููก ููู ุณูุจูููู ูฑูููููู ููููุซููู ุญูุจููุฉู ุฃููขุจูุชูุชก ุณูุจกุนู ุณูููุงุจููู ููู ููููู ุณููขุจูููุฉู ูููุงุฆูุฉู ุญูุจููุฉู ูููฑูููููู ููุถููฐุนููู ููููู ููุดูุงูุกู ูููฑูููููู ูููฐุณูุนู ุนูููููู</quran>  
*Translation*: "The example of those who spend their wealth in the Way of Allฤh is like a seed that grows seven ears, each bearing{G} a hundred grains. Allฤh multiplies [rewards] for whom He wills..." This verse illustrates the divine multiplication of rewards for charity.

2. **Surah Adh-Dhariyat (51:19)**:  
<quran ref="51:19">ูููููู ุฃููกูููฐูููููก ุญููู ููููุณููุขุฆููู ูููฑูกููุญกุฑูููู</quran>  
*Translation*: "And in their wealth was the right of the [needy] beggar and the deprived." This verse affirms that the needy have an inherent claim on believers' resources.

Both verses remind Muslims that supporting those in needเชค is not merely encouraged but a spiritual obligation, with Allah promising abundant rewards for sincere generosity.

promptResults.rawResponse:
The Quran places significant emphasis on giving to the needy, viewing it as a fundamental aspect of faith and an act of worship. Here are two relevant verses:

<quran ref="2:277">ุฅูููู ูฑูููุฐูููู ุกูุงูููููุง ููุนููููููุง ูฑูุตููููฐููุญูููฐุชู ููุฃูููุงูููุง ูฑูุตููููููฐุฉู ููุกูุงุชูููุง ูฑูุฒููููููฐุฉู ูููููู ุฃูุฌูุฑููููู ุนููุฏู ุฑูุจูููููู ููููุง ุฎููููู ุนููููููููู ููููุง ูููู ููุญูุฒูููููู</quran>
Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds and establish prayer and give zakah โ they will have their reward with their Lord, and no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.

<quran ref="17:26">ููุกูุงุชู ุฐูุง ูฑููููุฑูุจูููฐ ุญููููููฅ ูููฑููููุณูููููู ูููฑุจููู ูฑูุณููุจูููู ููููุง ุชูุจูุฐููุฑู ุชูุจูุฐููุฑูุง</quran>
And give the relative his due, and the needy and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.

These verses highlight giving to the needy as a righteous deed, often linked with prayer (salah) and zakah (obligatory charity), and underscore the importance of fulfilling the rights of the poor and those in need.
